channel.title: Getting my files from windows 7 onto Linux?
channel.description: Hey guys, I was wondering how I can get my Windows 7 files onto my Linux OS. If someone could tell me how or link me a tutorial that would be great :D Thanks!

item.title: Getting my files from windows 7 onto Linux?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Assuming he’s in Ubuntu, it should just show up as a drive in nautilus. If he were on Wubi (Ubuntu Windows installer), it’s located somewhere on the root linux drive.

Read full topic

item.source: Getting my files from windows 7 onto Linux?

item.title: Getting my files from windows 7 onto Linux?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

runewings317:

I would maybe consider, but another thing I don’t like about it is that it doesn’t have a Task Manager, so if something freezes, I’m done lol. That and I’m not going to be hosting anything on this O_o

Type “top” in the command line, and type in “sudo kill [PID]” to kill that process. Trust me, if you just play around with it, it will grow on you.

Also, to get even more specific, type in “ps aux|more” then you get every single process running. If you want to see all Java processes then type “ps aux|grep java”.

Edit:
Also, type in “Ctrl+C” to exit the “top” command. Ctrl+C is used to abort the current task, in most cases.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting my files from windows 7 onto Linux?

item.title: Getting my files from windows 7 onto Linux?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

It does have a task manager. If I’m not mistaken u can access it through the system info menu item under the system menu. U can access ur windows files from ur file explorer under the name of ur hdd I’m pretty sure I haven’t used my xubuntu install for awhile plus things are a little different on xubuntu compared to ubuntu.

Read full topic
